title: Granting Pardons and Commutation of Sentences for Certain Offenses Relating to the Events at or Near the United States Capitol on January 6, 2021
summary: The document is Proclamation 10887 issued by the President of the United States on January 20, 2025, addressing injustices related to the events at the United States Capitol on January 6, 2021. It announces the commutation of sentences for specific individuals convicted of related offenses to time served and grants full, unconditional pardons to all other individuals convicted for similar actions. The proclamation emphasizes the need for national reconciliation and instructs the Attorney General to ensure the immediate release of those currently imprisoned and to dismiss pending indictments against them. This action is positioned as a corrective measure to address perceived injustices over the past four years.
